text: William E. Coles Jr. (1932-2005) was an American novelist and professor. Born in Summit, New Jersey, Coles earned degrees from Lehigh University, the University of Connecticut, the University of Minnesota. From 1974 to 1998 he served as a professor and director of composition at the University of Pittsburgh. Coles died on March 21, 2005. He was survived by his wife, Janet Kafka."Obituary: William E. Coles, Jr." Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania: University Times, University of Pittsburgh, April 14, 2005. ==Books== * The Plural I, novel (1978). * Funnybone, novel (New York: Atheneum Books, 1992). * Another Kind of Monday, novel (New York: Atheneum Books, 1996). * Compass in the Blood, novel (New York: Atheneum Books, 2001). ==References== ==Sources== * Contemporary Authors Online.
